properties.areaDesc: Bayside and Gulf side from Craig Key to West End of Seven Mile Bridge; Gulf of Mexico from West End of Seven Mile Bridge to Halfmoon Shoal out to 5 Fathoms; Gulf waters from East Cape Sable to Chokoloskee 20 to 60 NM out and beyond 5 fathoms
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued January 31 at 11:21PM EST until February 1 at 12:15AM EST by NWS Key West FL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Key West has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Bay and Gulf Side from Craig Key to Halfmoon Shoal out to 5
fathoms...
Gulf Waters from East Cape Sable to Chokoloskee 20 to 60 nm out and
beyond 5 fathoms...

* Until 1215 AM EST.

* At 1115 PM EST, the Weatherflow station at Smith Shoal Light
reported at wind gust of 36 knots. This area of gale-force gusts
will spread east on the Gulfside and Bayside of the Lower and
Middle Keys.

HAZARD...Wind gusts 34 knots or greater.

SOURCE...Marine weather spotter.

IMPACT...Expect wind gusts in excess of 34 knots, suddenly higher
waves, frequent lightning, and heavy downpours.

* Locations in the warning include...
Raccoon Key, Northwest Channel Buoy 1, Snipe Point, P Tower, Smith
Shoal Light, Water Keys and Content Keys.
properties.instruction:
Prepare for wind gusts in excess of 34 knots, steep and fast-building
seas, and blinding downpours. Make sure all on board are wearing life
jackets.
